instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 not booting
threads.message: Mac Air 11 inch came in not working. Liquid damage many month ago, not too much but some sign of corrosion. No red/green light, after reflow SMC light came back but 0.1v on PPBUS. Replaced U7000 and I get 8.6 and fan spin but then the voltage is dropping slowlyy to about 6.5-7v. Also it doesnt boot I only have fan spin. CPU Vcore is present and the CPU gets hot. I guess this might be related to the SPI ROM data lines? Some corrosion around there so will check all of those. However I am wondering about the voltage drop on PPBUS, there is no short in that line.

threads.title: 820-3435 not booting
threads.message: The usual measurements around U7000 done? 17/18 27/28 etc. It is also unlikely if the board stopped and the liquid damage was months ago that there will be multiple dead chips.

threads.title: 820-3435 not booting
threads.message: I think it might still have had some liquid under some IC after my ultrasonic cleaning. After a weekend lying on the shelf it decided to start working :)
